edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.em

Class BernoulliMeanFieldEM

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.WeightLearningApplication
        • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.maxlikelihood.VotedPerceptron
          • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.em.ExpectationMaximization
            • edu.umd.cs.psl.application.learning.weight.em.BernoulliMeanFieldEM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelApplication

    public class BernoulliMeanFieldEM
extends ExpectationMaximization
    EM algorithm which fits a Bernoulli mean field (product of independent Bernoulli distributions) during the E-step.

    During the E-step, the mean field is fit via block coordinate descent.

    During the M-step, the likelihood is maximized using the voted perceptron algorithm with the expectation of the potential functions estimated using the MPE state.

    This algorithm does not support models with constraints.

      • CONFIG_PREFIX

      • MPE_INITIALIZATION_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String MPE_INITIALIZATION_KEY
        Key for Boolean property. If true, the mean field will be reinitialized via MPE inference at each round. If false, each mean will be initialized to 0.5 before the first round.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
